content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 1 to node 2 in the given graph is:

1->3->4

If the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. Therefore, the shortest path from node 2 to node 1 in the reversed graph would be:

4->3->1

Note that these are the shortest paths in the graph, and they may include more than one edge if there are multiple ways to get from one node to another.

The shortest path from node 2 to node 1 in the given graph is:

2->5

Note that this is the shortest path in the graph, and it may include more than one edge if there are multiple ways to get from one node to another. If you need a different format for the shortest path, please let me know.
